summary.title: ShareNote
summary.description:
The system under study is a web-based collaborative note-taking app, called ShareNote. The app allows users to
create notes, and share them so others can either read or edit notes, depending on permissions set by the creator
of the note. Users can also comment on notes.

data.name: Logged-in User
data.description: Logged-in users are registered users who have successfully authenticated into the ShareNote system. They can view notes they have access to, create new notes, and share their notes with other users either publicly or through private share links. Additionally, they can comment on notes they have permission to access.

threats.title: User identity spoofing. Credential too weak or stolen
threats.description: Credentials of user can be stolen or guessed. Attacker may impersonate users to gain access to notes
threats.mitigation: Enforce strong authentication, session management.

threats.title: Repudiation of Performed Actions
threats.description: A logged-in user might deny having performed an action, such as editing a note or sharing it, making it difficult to hold them accountable.
threats.mitigation:
- Maintain tamper-proof audit logs
- Include timestamps and user IDs in logs
- Digitally sign critical transactions or records
- Restrict access to log modification

threats.title: Impersonation of Another User
threats.description: A user may attempt to masquerade as another user by guessing session tokens, forging cookies, or manipulating request headers.
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce strong session management
- Validate authentication tokens
- Reject requests without valid credentials

data.name: create request
data.description:
create request data contains:
* userld: String
* title: String
* content: Content

threats.title: Bypass permission checks
threats.description: Access or edit notes without authorization
threats.mitigation: Enforce strict backend authorization, validate every action against role

data.description:
modification request data contains:
* admin credentials
* operation data

system modification data contains:

share confirmation data

- or:
* message (Indicates success or failure of the operation)

* sharedNoteld: String

* accessLevel:Enum {Read,Write}

share note request

* public: Boolean
- or:
* ownerUserId: String
* noteId: String
* linkAccessLevel: Enum{Read, Write}

data.name: ShareNote secured fire wall
data.description: The user and the server are separated

note and comment data contains:

data.name: modification confirmation
data.description:
modification confirmation data contains:
* message (Indicates success or failure of the operation)
* the data returned by the system and displayed on the interface, can be note data, comment data, SharedNote data

data.name: Create Note
data.description: Action for a user to create a note for themselves in the ShareNote system.

threats.title: HTTPS downgrade attack
threats.description: Attempt to access site via HTTP
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce HTTPS with HSTS headers
- Redirect HTTP request to HTTPS

threats.title: Excessive Note Creating Requests
threats.description: A user sends a large number of create requests, overloading the server or database.
threats.mitigation:
- Enable DDOS protection on reverse proxy server
- Enable CAPTCHA
- Apply rate limiting per user/IP
- Cache non-sensitive content
- Monitor and block abnormal request patterns

threats.title: Impersonation of Another User to Create Note
threats.description: An attacker attempts to create a note under another user’s account by forging authentication credentials or session tokens.
threats.mitigation:
- Validate session tokens for each request
- Enforce server-side checks to confirm note ownership
- Use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for sensitive actions

threats.title: Injection of Malicious Content
threats.description: A user inserts harmful scripts or malicious code into the note content to exploit other users when the note is viewed.
threats.mitigation:
- Implement server-side input validation and sanitization
- Use context-aware output encoding
- Apply Content Security Policy (CSP) to prevent script execution

threats.title: Repudiation of Note Creation
threats.description: A user denies creating a specific note, making it hard to hold them accountable.
threats.mitigation:
- Maintain tamper-proof creation logs
- Include user ID, timestamp, and note metadata in logs
- Store logs in an append-only or immutable format

threats.title: Unauthorized Access to Sensitive Data
threats.description: The note creation process inadvertently exposes sensitive information through debug messages, error responses, or unsecured storage.
threats.mitigation:
- Avoid including sensitive data in client responses
- Use secure error handling without revealing internal details
- Encrypt sensitive fields in storage

threats.title: Escalating Privileges through Note Creation
threats.description: A user exploits the note creation function to gain unauthorized privileges, such as setting themselves as the owner of another user’s note.
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce strict server-side ownership assignment
- Validate all role and permission changes
- Implement role-based access control (RBAC) at the database level

data.name: Content Datastore
data.description:
Content store
text:String
images:List<lmage>
links:List<Link>
referencedNotes:List<Note>

data.name: Comment Datastore
data.description:
commentld: String
content: Text
createdAt: DateTime
author:User

data.name: Comment on Note
data.description: Action for a user to comment on a specific note they can access in the ShareNote system.

threats.title: Note or comment tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized editing or deletion via compromised session or link without authorization.
threats.mitigation:
- Use secure tokens, validate permissions on every request.
- Implement role-based permissions for comment management

threats.title: Denial of creating/editing notes or comments
threats.description: A user denies having created or removed a comment, making it difficult to trace actions.
threats.mitigation:
- Maintain tamper-proof comment logs
- Include user ID, timestamp, and note ID in records
- Store logs in an append-only format

threats.title: Flooding note creation/comments
threats.description: A malicious user sends a large number of comment requests, overloading the server or database and overwhelm storage.
threats.mitigation:
- Limit number of comment submissions per user under the same note
- Enable DDOS protection on reverse proxy server
- Enable CAPTCHA
- Apply rate limiting per user/IP
- Cache non-sensitive content
- Monitor and block abnormal request patterns

threats.title: HTTPS downgrade attack
threats.description: Attempt to access site via HTTP
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce HTTPS with HSTS headers
- Redirect HTTP request to HTTPS

threats.title: Impersonation of Another User to Comment on Note
threats.description: An attacker attempts to comment on a note under another user’s account by forging authentication credentials or session tokens.
threats.mitigation:
- Validate session tokens for each request
- Enforce server-side checks to confirm note ownership
- Use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for sensitive actions

threats.title: Unauthorized Access to Sensitive Data
threats.description: The commenting process inadvertently exposes sensitive information through debug messages, error responses, or unsecured storage.
threats.mitigation:
- Avoid including sensitive data in client responses
- Use secure error handling without revealing internal details
- Encrypt sensitive fields in storage

threats.title: Leaking Sensitive Information Through Comments
threats.description: Comments may inadvertently contain sensitive content (e.g., private note details, credentials) that becomes visible to others.
threats.mitigation:
- Educate users about safe content in comments
- Allow note owners to delete inappropriate comments
- Restrict comment visibility based on note access

threats.title: Injection of Malicious Content
threats.description: A user inserts harmful scripts or malicious code into the comment to exploit other users when the note is viewed.
threats.mitigation:
- Implement server-side input validation and sanitization
- Use context-aware output encoding
- Apply Content Security Policy (CSP) to prevent script execution

data.name: Share Note
data.description: Action for a note creator to share a note by making it public in read-only mode or by generating a secret link granting read or edit access to specific users.

threats.title: Shared link misuse
threats.description: Link-based access lacks identity verification.
threats.mitigation: Add optional login requirement for link-based access.

threats.title: Replay attacks with links
threats.description: Editing via previously shared links.
threats.mitigation: Implement link expiry, one-time use options.

threats.title: Leaking Secret Share Links
threats.description: Private share links may be exposed via referrer headers, browser history, or intercepted if not protected. Anyone with the link may access sensitive content.
threats.mitigation:
- Generate high-entropy, unguessable tokens
- Allow owners to revoke share links and set expiration times

threats.title: Public notes indexed by search engines
threats.description: Public notes may unintentionally expose data.
threats.mitigation: Use robots.txt, add warnings before making notes public.

threats.title: Excessive Viewing Requests
threats.description: A user sends a large number of share note requests, overloading the server or database.
threats.mitigation:
- Enable DDOS protection on reverse proxy server
- Enable CAPTCHA
- Apply rate limiting per user/IP
- Cache non-sensitive content
- Monitor and block abnormal request patterns

threats.title: HTTPS downgrade attack
threats.description: Attempt to access site via HTTP
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce HTTPS with HSTS headers
- Redirect HTTP request to HTTPS

threats.title: Impersonation of Another User to Share Note
threats.description: An attacker attempts to share a note under another user’s account by forging authentication credentials or session tokens.
threats.mitigation:
- Validate session tokens for each request
- Enforce server-side checks to confirm note ownership
- Use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for sensitive actions

threats.title: Unauthorized Access to Sensitive Data
threats.description: The sharing note process inadvertently exposes sensitive information through debug messages, error responses, or unsecured storage.
threats.mitigation:
- Avoid including sensitive data in client responses
- Use secure error handling without revealing internal details
- Encrypt sensitive fields in storage

threats.title: Altering Share Permissions
threats.description: A malicious user modifies parameters (e.g., accessLevel, public flag) in the share request to grant unauthorized access.
threats.mitigation:
- Validate all input server-side
- Enforce role-based access control (RBAC) at the API level
- Reject unauthorized changes to note permissions

threats.title: Denying a Share Action
threats.description: A user claims they never shared a note, making it difficult to prove the action took place.
threats.mitigation:
- Maintain tamper-proof share activity logs
- Include user ID, note ID, access level, and timestamp
- Protect logs from modification

threats.title: Escalating Access Through Sharing
threats.description: A user with limited permissions shares a note in a way that grants themselves or others higher privileges (e.g., read → edit).
threats.mitigation:
- Validate permission changes on the server
- Restrict share operations to authorized roles
- Require explicit confirmation for privilege-increasing shares

data.name: SharedNote Datastore
data.description:
sharedNoteld: String
note: Note
public:Boolean
sharedWith:List<User>
accessLevel:Enum {Read, Write}

data.name: Database Server Administrator
data.description: Database server administrator are privileged users with control over the ShareNote system. They can manage user accounts, assign permissions, delete content, perform backups, and directly modify the database through administrative processes.

threats.title: Impersonation of an Administrator Account
threats.description: An attacker or malicious insider may attempt to gain administrator privileges by stealing admin credentials, forging admin session tokens, or exploiting authentication flaws.
threats.mitigation:
- Require Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for admin logins
- Restrict admin access to trusted IP ranges or VPN
- Use strong, unique passwords with enforced rotation
- Monitor and alert on unusual login activity

threats.title: Repudiation of Administrative Actions
threats.description: An administrator could deny having performed a system change (e.g., deleting a note, modifying the database), making accountability difficult.
threats.mitigation:
- Maintain secure, tamper-proof audit logs
- Digitally sign and timestamp all administrative actions
- Store logs in an append-only system
- Regularly review logs with separation of duties

data.name: Modify System Data
data.description: Action for an administrator to directly update, insert, or delete records in the database, including user accounts, notes, comments, and system configurations.

threats.title: Audit Logging
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Track all key user and system actions

threats.title: Impersonating an Administrator
threats.description: An attacker gains access to admin credentials or session tokens and uses the modify system data process to alter critical records.
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for admin accounts
- Restrict admin access to trusted IPs or VPNs
- Monitor and alert on unusual admin activity

threats.title: Repudiation of Administrative Actions
threats.description: An administrator could deny having performed a system change (e.g., deleting a note, modifying the database), making accountability difficult.
threats.mitigation:
- Maintain secure, tamper-proof audit logs
- Digitally sign and timestamp all administrative actions
- Store logs in an append-only system
- Regularly review logs with separation of duties

threats.title: Exposing Sensitive Data During Modification
threats.description: Admin changes may reveal sensitive data in logs, error messages, or insecure channels.
threats.mitigation:
- Mask sensitive fields in logs
- Use secure channels for all admin operations (HTTPS/SSH)
- Restrict access

threats.title: Privilege Abuse
threats.description: Admin (Database Server Administrator and Internal Staff) uses modify system data process to grant themselves or another account higher privileges than intended.
threats.mitigation:
- Separate admin roles (e.g., DB admin vs. app admin)
- Require change approvals for privilege alterations
- Periodically review account privileges

threats.title: Resource Exhaustion Through Bulk Changes
threats.description: Admin runs heavy modification scripts or queries that overwhelm the database or lock key tables.
threats.mitigation:
- Limit the size and frequency of bulk operations
- Schedule large changes during maintenance windows
- Implement query execution timeouts

data.name: Anonymous user (Guest)
data.description: Guests are users who have not logged into the ShareNote system. They can view public notes but cannot create, edit, comment on, or share notes.

threats.title: Impersonation of Another User
threats.description: A guest may attempt to masquerade as another user by guessing session tokens, forging cookies, or manipulating request headers.
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce strong session management
- Validate authentication tokens
- Reject requests without valid credentials

threats.title: False Action Denial
threats.description: Unauthenticated guests can perform actions (e.g., access public content) and later deny having done so, making tracking difficult.
threats.mitigation:
- Use IP-based logging
- Implement request fingerprinting
- Append anonymous session IDs to activity logs

data.name: View Note
data.description: Action for a user to view a specific note they have permission to access in the ShareNote system

threats.title: Unauthorized Access to Notes
threats.description: An attacker pretends to be an authorized user (e.g., by using stolen session tokens) to view notes they shouldn’t have access to.
threats.mitigation:
- Validate session tokens for every request
- Enforce strict server-side access control
- Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for sensitive accounts

threats.title: Manipulating Request Parameters
threats.description: A user alters parameters (e.g., noteId) in the request to view another user’s note without permission.
threats.mitigation:
- Perform server-side authorization checks
- Validate all input against expected formats

threats.title: Exposure of Sensitive Information
threats.description: Viewing a note may expose sensitive content to unauthorized parties if access control is flawed or the note is cached in public areas.
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce strict access checks before returning content
- Prevent caching of sensitive pages

threats.title: Excessive Viewing Requests
threats.description: A user sends a large number of view requests, overloading the server or database.
threats.mitigation:
- Enable DDOS protection on reverse proxy server
- Enable CAPTCHA
- Apply rate limiting per user/IP
- Cache non-sensitive content
- Monitor and block abnormal request patterns

threats.title: Bypassing Read-Only Restrictions
threats.description: A user with read-only access exploits a flaw to modify the note while viewing it.
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce permissions at the API and database level
- Use role-based access control
- Validate all requests against allowed actions

threats.title: HTTPS downgrade attack
threats.description: Attempt to access site via HTTP
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce HTTPS with HSTS headers
- Redirect HTTP request to HTTPS
